metadata.Title: CVE-2023-3247 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description: In PHP versions 8.0.* before 8.0.29, 8.1.* before 8.1.20, 8.2.* before8.2.7 when using SOAP HTTP Digest Authentication, random value generatorwas not checked for failure, and was using narrower range of values than itshould have. In case of random generator failure, it could lead to adisclosure of 31 bits of uninitialized memory from the client to theserver, and it also made easier to a malicious server to guess the client'snonce.

criterions.comment: php7.2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
